article.headline: Detroit 88, Eastern Michigan 83
article.story: DETROIT (AP) -- Brandon Cotton scored 27 points Monday to lead Detroit Mercy past Eastern Michigan 88-83 on Monday night. The sophomore, a 2002-03 McDonald's All-American who played just three games at Michigan State last season before transferring, made 12 of his 17 field-goal attempts, including three in the final five minutes. Torvoris Baker had a career-high 19 points and eight rebounds for Detroit (3-6), which got 14 points and seven boards from Chuck Bailey. Darryl Garrett finished with 28 points to lead the Eagles (6-2), who had won four straight. Marcus Austin added 24. The Titans never trailed in the second half, but Eastern stayed close until the last five minutes. With Detroit up two, Cotton drove for a layup, then converted another a minute later to push Detroit's edge to five points. The Eagles stayed in the game in the second half by hitting 23 of their 30 free-throw attempts. They finished the game 35-for-47 at the line.
